data.title: Becoming a Respiratory Therapist
data.meta_description: Start your journey to becoming a respiratory therapist with Nationwide Children's Hospital. Find an accredited program and scholarship opportunities.
data.text:
Interested in becoming a respiratory therapist? We have gathered a few resources to help you on this exciting journey. To find the information that's best suited to your needs, select one of the links below.

Why be an RT? The American Association for Respiratory Care shares educational and information for those interested in the respiratory care profession.

Find a Respiratory Therapy School

Nationwide Children's Hospital hires candidates who have graduated from an accredited school with state board approval.

The Commission on Accreditation for Respiratory Care (CoARC) is the organization responsible for the accreditation of respiratory therapy educational programs. To access a current list of accredited respiratory therapist programs, go to the CoARC website. There you can search for programs by name, state, degree, or category. You can also compare programs.

Respiratory Therapy Schools in Ohio: The Ohio Society for Respiratory Care provides a list of Respiratory Therapy Schools in Ohio.

Respiratory Therapy Resources

American Association for Respiratory Care (AARC): A national and international professional association for respiratory therapists, students, and anyone working in a field related to respiratory therapy.

The National Board for Respiratory Care (NBRC): A non-profit organization formed in 1960 with the purpose of awarding and maintaining credentialing for Respiratory Therapists in the United States.

Ohio Society for Respiratory Care (OSRC): A non-profit professional association that is a chartered affiliate of the American Association for Respiratory Care (AARC). They advise and promote the education, licensure, safety and quality of Respiratory Care services, issues and diseases.
